posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
This build combines the offence of a Ranger with the defence of Risen Lord form. When shifted it has 50% Piercing DI, 50% Slashing DI, and 9/- DR, along with the usual undead immunities. The main advantage of this build over a Rang/PM is the Risen Lord DI, in general a Rang/PM is a better build.

Unfortunately the build has many negatives, including mediocre AB, low AC, mediocre saves, and being a Shifter. With Humanoid Shape at 30 and Undead Shape at 33 this build is a very late bloomer. I don't recommend playing this solo in tough environments since your ranged attacks and traps will be fairly underwhelming. Since it is undead it can only be healed with Harm, which makes self-healing difficult while shifted and causes trouble for friendly healers. This build works best on servers where item merging is changed so AC sources stack normally rather than being converted to Deflection AC.

The best races for this build are dwarf, human, and gnome. Human removes the multiclass penalty and gives an extra feat but it reduces your DEX by 2. I chose dwarf for the higher AC and increased carry capacity when unshifted, if I was to change the race I would choose human over anything else.
Swapping Weapon Finesse for Toughness at level 1 might make levelling easier but ultimately this will make for a weaker level 40 build so I wouldn't recommend it. Expertise and Improved Expertise might help when tanking in a party, but your AB is too low to use them properly when solo and with vanilla item merging there's no point in even trying for AC anyway. The Favored Enemies chosen below are for PvP, they will need to be altered depending on your environment.
The build can be improved by moving Dru5 to level 29 but that requires moving Undead Shape to level 39 which is too much of a sacrifice for +6 Spellcraft in my opinion.

There's only one Rang/Shif build on the archive but there are several Rang/PM builds on there.
The only level layouts I recommend for Rang/PM builds are Rang21/Bard3/PM16, Rang21/Bard4/PM15, and Rang26/Bard4/PM10, anything else is a waste.

Bard3/Rang21/PM16 by Hediyoshi. [http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 23972.html]
A STR/CON based Rang/PM with EDR3 and epic spells. Some things need tweaking, but overall a decent concept.

Dru13/Rang10/Shif17 by ManOWarr. [http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 02562.html]
A WIS based Rang/Shif with Epic Kobold Commando, Rakshasa, and Risen Lord forms. Not getting Bane makes the build pointless in my opinion, choosing Fighter or Monk would result in a better build.

Rang21/Bard5/PM14 by Saosin777. [http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 17827.html]
A STR based Rang/PM with Dev Crit. Only going for PM14 means that it lacks epic spells, the only real advantage of going beyond PM10.

Rang26/Bard4/PM10 by Kail Pendragon. [http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 51653.html]
A STR based Rang/PM. Very solid build with both Taunt and UMD.

Rang26/Bard4/PM10 by TyrTemplar. [http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 72105.html]
A STR based Rang/PM with Dev Crit. Another solid build.

Rang21/Wiz7/PM12 by billb0. [http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 22129.html]
A STR based Rang/PM with Dev Crit. It can cast 7th level mage spells but with such a low caster level it's not worth dropping what Bard offers.

Wiz3/Rang21/PM16 by rakh-talazar. [http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 76041.html]
A DEX based Rang/PM. It can cast 6th level mage spells but again I don't think it's worth dropping Bard levels.
